raw_text:
Sundance to honour foreign films
 
 International films will be given the same prominence as US films at next year's Sundance Film Festival, with movies dominated by the theme of war.
 
 The independent film festival will feature two new international cinema competitions, during its 20-30 January season in Utah. Forty-two films will debut at Sundance, including The Liberace of Baghdad by British director Sean McAllister. The prestigious festival was founded by actor Robert Redford in 1981.
 
 "We have always had an international component, but from next year they will enter a jury competition," festival director Geoffrey Gilmore said. "We wanted to give world cinema more emphasis and have now put it on par with the American dramatic and documentary competitions." Twelve films competing in the new world cinema documentary category focus on countries and people under siege.
 
 The Liberace of Baghdad features an Iraqi pianist hiding in a hotel as he waits for a visa, while Finnish film The Three Rooms of Melancholia looks at the war in Chechnya. Shake Hands With The Devil: The Journey of Romeo Dallaire tells of a UN mission to Rwanda during the 1994 genocide, while French-Israeli production Wall looks at Israel's controversial security wall separating it from the Palestinian territories. The 16 films competing in the new world cinema dramatic category include works from Germany, South Korea, Angola, China, Denmark and Australia.
 
 Several Hollywood stars feature in the festival's American independent drama category, including Keanu Reeves and Benjamin Bratt. Vince Vaughn stars in quirky movie Thumbsucker while 21 Grams actress Naomi Watts plays a budding Hollywood actress in Ellie Parker. The top Grand Jury prize at this year's festival went to low budget sci-fi thriller Primer, written and directed by Shane Carruth. Morgan Spurlock earned the directing award for Super Size Me, which became an international box office hit.
llama3.2:1b: International films will receive equal prominence at Sundance with US films starting from next year. The festival will feature two new international cinema competitions: a world cinema documentary category focusing on countries under siege and a world cinema dramatic category including works from Germany, South Korea, Angola, China, Denmark, and Australia.
llama3.2:3b: Sundance Film Festival will give equal prominence to international films as US films next year, with a focus on war movies. The festival will feature two new international cinema competitions and 42 film debuts, including "The Liberace of Baghdad" and works by Hollywood stars in the American independent drama category.
gemma2:2b: The 2023 Sundance Film Festival will feature two new international cinema competitions highlighting films about war.  The festival will showcase 42 films from various countries and directors. These include films focused on war in Chechnya and Rwanda, alongside those examining the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Several Hollywood actors are featured in the American independent drama category.
qwen2.5:0.5b: International films like US films will be featured more in the 20-30 January season at the 2018-2019 Sundance Film Festival, and there will be a new competition called "world cinema". Some of the movies that are popular with viewers include: The Liberace of Baghdad by Sean McAllister; The Three Rooms of Melancholia by Theodoros Stylianou; Shake Hands With The Devil: The Journey of Romeo Dallaire by David Cronenberg; French-Israeli production Wall looks at Israel's controversial security wall separating it from the Palestinian territories.
qwen2.5:1.5b: The Sundance Film Festival will feature two new international cinema competitions, including films on war themes, as of next year, placing them on par with American dramas and documentaries.
qwen2.5:3b: Sundance Film Festival will give equal importance to both US and foreign films starting next year, focusing on war-themed movies. The festival features two new international cinema competitions with 42 debut films including works from countries under siege. Notable films include 'The Liberace of Baghdad,' a documentary about an Iraqi pianist during the Iraq War, and 'Wall,' a drama about Israel's security barrier separating it from Palestinian territories. Other notable entries feature Hollywood stars such as Keanu Reeves, Benjamin Bratt, Naomi Watts, Vince Vaughn, and 21 Grams actress Ellen Burstyn. The festival also features American independent dramas with high-profile actors like Keanu Reeves and Benjamin Bratt. Previous winners include 'Primer' for Best Director and 'Super Size Me' for Directing Award.
opencoder:1.5b:
International films will be given the same prominence as US films at next year's Sundance Film Festival with movies dominated by the theme of war.
The independent film festival is scheduled to feature two new international cinema competitions during its 20-30 January season in Utah. Forty-two films will debut at Sundance, including The Liberace of Baghdad by British director Sean McAllister.
"Internationally, we have always had an integral part," said the director Geoffrey Gilmore. "We wanted to give world cinema more emphasis and have now embraced it on par with the American dramatic and documentary competitions." Twelve films compete in the new world cinema drama category focusing on countries and people under siege.
The Liberace of Baghdad is a 192-minute film, featuring an Iraqi pianist hiding in a hotel as he waits for a visa. The film unfolds a historical and political expedition that illustrates the actions and consequences of a UN mission to Rwanda during the 1994 genocide.
The 16 films in this category feature works from Germany, South Korea, Angola, China, Denmark, and Australia, all written and directed by actors who are internationally recognized for their work. The film explores human conflict and political instability as well as China's role in the UN Security Assertion Network's policy-making process.
Several stars feature on these films at the festival’s American independent drama category, including Keanu Reeves and Benjamin Bratt.
Vince Vaughn plays a character who is not only quirky but also a budding Hollywood actor who plays Ellie Parker on a screen with 21 Grams.
The prize at this year's festival went to low budget sci-fi thriller Primer by Shane Carruth. Morgan Spurlock earned the directing award for Super Size Me, which gained international attention and became an international box office hit.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Alright, I need to summarize the given text concisely while preserving key ideas and details.

First, the main event is Sundance Film Festival honoring foreign films with a focus on war themes. The festival will feature two new competitions in January in Utah, including The Liberace of Baghdad by Sean McAllister from Britain.

Next, there's Robert Redford's founding of the festival in 1981 and its current emphasis on international component, now matching American films.

Then, details about the new categories: world cinema documentaries focusing on siege situations with 12 films, and world cinema dramas focusing on various countries. Specific movies like Shake Hands With The Devil are included there as well.

Also, highlighting Hollywood stars and other notable actors in the festival's schedule will give a good overview of what's happening.

I should make sure all key points—festival structure, themes, director comments, participating films—are included without too much explanation or formatting.
</think>

Sundance Film Festival will honor foreign films with a focus on war themes, featuring two new international competitions this year. In Utah from January 20 to 30, fourteen films, including The Liberace of Baghdad and Shake Hands With The Devil, will debut. The festival was founded by Robert Redford in 1981 and now emphasizes world cinema, mirroring American film categories.

Key participants include Sean McAllister's The Liberace of Baghdad, a British film featuring an Iraqi pianist, and Shake Hands With The Devil, which follows UN mission operations during the 1994 genocide. Hollywood stars Keanu Reeves, Benjamin Bratt, Vince Vaughn, Naomi Watts, Morgan Spurlock, and Shane Carruth will also be featured.

The festival will award top prizes like Primer (2017) for its low-budget sci-fi thriller and Super Size Me (2016) for directing.
tinyllama:1.1b: The Sundance Film Festival will feature a new competition for films that have a "prestigious" focus, highlighting foreign cinema during its upcoming season in Utah. The festival is planning to add two international cinema competitions to the usual American drama and documentary competitions. World cinema documentaries will compete with world cinema drama and three films from each category will feature in the new competition for world cinema films. Hollywood stars like Keanu Reeves, Benjamin Bratt, Vincy Vaud, Naomi Watts, and Elli Peart are among those featured in this year's festival's American independent drama categories. The top Grand Jury prize at Sundance went to low budget sci-fi thriller Primer, directed by Shane Carruth, while Morgan Spurlock earned the directing award for Super Size Me.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Sundance Film Festival will honor foreign films in a new way next year with two international cinema competitions that will be judged by a prestigious jury. The first is for war-themed films and the second will feature works from countries and people under siege, including Iraqi pianist The Liberace of Baghdad and Finnish film The Three Rooms of Melancholia. Both competitions will include international cinema dramatic films alongside American independent films in a bid to showcase world cinema.

The prestigious festival in Utah features forty-two foreign movies, including The Liberace of Baghdad and Wall. Twelve films competing are from countries and people under siege. Hollywood stars feature in the American independent drama category. Sundance's director Geoffrey Gilmore said they wanted to give world cinema more emphasis and it will enter a jury competition starting next year.

The festival will showcase 42 films, including Iraq-related documentaries and films on Rwanda, Israel, and other countries. A new grand jury prize will be awarded to the best American independent drama film. Hollywood actors Keanu Reeves and Benjamin Bratt will feature in the festival's American independent drama category, while Naomi Watts plays a budding Hollywood actress in Ellie Parker. The top Grand Jury prize at this year's festival went to low budget sci-fi thriller Primer, written and directed by Shane Carruth.
hermes3:3b: Sundance Film Fest to highlight international films, with 2 new intl cinema competitions next year. 42 films set to debut, including The Liberace of Baghdad.

The festival will introduce two international cinema competitions during its January season in Utah. This year's edition features 42 film premieres, including works from Iraq, Chechnya, Rwanda, and Israel-Palestine. The American independent drama category includes stars like Keanu Reeves, Benjamin Bratt, Vince Vaughn, and Naomi Watts.

The festival, running from 20-30 January in Utah, will debut 42 films, many centered on war. The world cinema documentary category includes films on Iraq, Chechnya, Rwanda, and Israel’s security wall, while the dramatic category features entries from Germany, South Korea, Angola, China, Denmark, and Australia. Hollywood stars such as Keanu Reeves, Benjamin Bratt, Vince Vaughn, and Naomi Watts appear in the American independent drama section. The festival, founded by Robert Redford in 1981, previously awarded its top Grand Jury prize to Primer and recognized Morgan Spurlock for Super Size Me.
stablelm2:1.6b: Sundance will honor foreign films with war themes during the 2019 event. Around 45 films will debut at Sundance in January, including "The Liberace of Baghdad." The festival aims to give world cinema equal prominence as US dramatic and documentary competitions. Notable international titles include "The Three Rooms of Melancholia," "Shake Hands With The Devil: The Journey of Romeo Dallaire," and "Wall." Hollywood actors feature in the American independent drama category, while low budget sci-fi thriller "Primer" won the Grand Jury prize.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Next year's Sundance Film Festival (January 20-30, Utah) will accord equal prominence to international films as US films, with a focus on war themes. The festival, founded by Robert Redford in 1981, will introduce two new international cinema competitions: the world cinema documentary category (12 films) and the dramatic category (16 films). These categories highlight countries and people affected by conflict, including Iraq, Chechnya, Rwanda, and Israel's security wall. Notable international films in the festival include The Liberace of Baghdad, Finnish film The Three Rooms of Melancholia, Shake Hands With The Devil: The Journey of Romeo Dallaire, Wall, Germany's Thumbsucker, and 21 Grams. Hollywood stars like Keanu Reeves and Benjamin Bratt participate in the American independent drama category. Last year's Grand Jury prize winner was Primer, a low-budget sci-fi thriller. Morgan Spurlock received the directing award for Super Size Me.
reference: The independent film festival will feature two new international cinema competitions, during its 20-30 January season in Utah.International films will be given the same prominence as US films at next year's Sundance Film Festival, with movies dominated by the theme of war.Twelve films competing in the new world cinema documentary category focus on countries and people under siege.The 16 films competing in the new world cinema dramatic category include works from Germany, South Korea, Angola, China, Denmark and Australia.The Liberace of Baghdad features an Iraqi pianist hiding in a hotel as he waits for a visa, while Finnish film The Three Rooms of Melancholia looks at the war in Chechnya.Forty-two films will debut at Sundance, including The Liberace of Baghdad by British director Sean McAllister.
